page.title: 03 Barnwell School
page.content: Barnwell C.E.(Aided) Primary School was built in 1875. The school is 10metres 66cms. high. There are two classes, a kitchen and a corridor. The infant class is on the right and our class is on the left. Mr. Parkes is the Head Master. In maths I am looking at shapes and counting the sides. In spelling workshop we fill in the word which we think makes the sentence right. We do ALL ROUND ENGLISH books which have word puzzles that you have to solve. On Thursday Mrs. Bird comes and teaches us about cowboys and Indians. The school has 39 pupils and is hoping to have an extension built with indoor lavatories. The doors in the classroom are 2metres high and quite hard to open.
